title: INtopBackup
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Staff and tourists among 25 killed in Goa nightclub fire
items.description: Officials believe a gas canister explosion triggered the fire which tore through the busy nightlife venue.

items.title: Ukrainian city hit by 'massive' strike as peace talks in US conclude
items.description: Russia carried out strikes on Kremenchuk, while its defence ministry said it had shot down 77 Ukrainian drones in several locations.

items.title: Japan is facing a dementia crisis – can technology help?
items.description: Japan's ageing population is putting strain on national budgets and society as a whole, but researchers are developing solutions to ease the pressure.

items.title: A new museum in Doha celebrates Indian art legend MF Husain
items.description: Lawh Wa Qalam is dedicated to the late Indian artist whose prolific paintings fascinated the world.

items.title: 12/6: Saturday Morning
items.description: The U.S. is facing record-low temperatures and severe weather. Meanwhile, President Trump was awarded a peace prize at the FIFA Men's World Cup draw.

items.title: At least 23 killed in nightclub fire in India
items.description: The blaze occurred just past midnight in Arpora in North Goa, a party hub.

items.title: 7 deaths and hundreds of injuries are linked to faulty Abbott glucose monitors
items.description: About 3 million glucose monitoring sensors were potentially affected by a production error that caused incorrect low glucose readings.

items.title: Waymo will recall software after its self-driving cars passed stopped school buses
items.description: Waymo is issuing a software recall for its self-driving cars after reports the company's autonomous vehicles failed to stop for school buses.

items.title: Man wounded in 2nd stabbing attack on North Carolina commuter train since August
items.description: Police in North Carolina have charged a 33-year-old man with stabbing someone on a commuter train in Charlotte.
